intro: Sebastiania glandulosa f. olfersiana, commonly known as the Olfers' glandular sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers clustered in dense inflorescences. The plant features opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, glandular hairs. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is typically found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
